docs.lead_paragraph: A newborn girl was fighting for her life a day after Utah police say her mother dumped her in a neighbor's trash can, an act the woman's parents said Wednesday that she didn't fully comprehend.

docs.lead_paragraph: We fear alcohol’s bad effects too much, and those of food too little.
docs.abstract: Mark Bittman Op-Ed column examines cultural attitudes toward drinking, and disputes notion that anyone drinks alcohol moderately for health benefits; notes discrepancy in way drinking alcohol and eating food are treated by health community, as dangers of alcohol are widely known and warned against, whereas dangers of bad diets are not.
docs.snippet: We fear alcohol’s bad effects too much, and those of food too little.

docs.lead_paragraph: Recent scandals have focused scrutiny on the largely unregulated practice of paid surrogate motherhood, prompting a government crackdown.

headline.main: Thailand’s Business in Paid Surrogates May Be Foundering in a Moral Quagmire
headline.print_headline: Thailand’s Business in Paid Surrogates May Be Foundering in a Moral Quagmire

docs.abstract: Thailand's military government says it planning to end lucrative cottage industry of women carrying babies for foreigners, mainly couples from wealthier Asian nations; commercial surrogacy has been available for at least a decade in Thailand, one of only a handful of countries where it is allowed, and one of only two in Asia, making it a prime destination for couples from countries where practice is banned.
docs.snippet: Recent scandals have focused scrutiny on the largely unregulated practice of paid surrogate motherhood, prompting a government crackdown.

keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
keywords.name: glocations

byline.contributor: Poypiti Amatatham contributed reporting from Bangkok, and Michelle Innis from Sydney, Australia.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Utah woman accused of dumping her day-old baby in a neighbor's trash can told police she was afraid to tell her parents about the pregnancy and hoped the newborn's death would solve her problems, a probable cause statement shows.
